lead_paragraph: The state is demanding to limit the number of refugees it accepts and receive additional security assurances, though a withdrawal from the program may not have much effect.

headline.print_headline: Texas Threatens to Leave Federal Refugee Resettlement Program
headline.main: Texas Threatens to Pull Out of Refugee Resettlement Program

snippet: The state is demanding to limit the number of refugees it accepts and receive additional security assurances, though a withdrawal from the program may not have much effect....
abstract: Texas, top state for refugee relocations, threatens to pull out of federal resettlement program unless its requests for additional security measures and refugee limits are accepted by Obama administration; advocates say exit of Texas from federal program will have no effect on placement and support of refugees there, given that state's nonprofits will take up slack.
